description: Successive rows of a triangle, the columns of which are generalized Fibonacci sequences S(j).
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, >Rows n = 1..125 of table, flattened
Russell Walsmith, CL-Chemy Transforms Fibonacci-Type Sequences to Arrays
formula: The j-th column S(j) is generated by a(n+1) = (n+j)*a(n) + a(n-1), a(0)=0, a(1)=1.
prog: (Haskell)a058294 n k = a058294_tabf !! (n-1) !! (k-1)a058294_row n = a058294_tabf !! (n-1)a058294_tabf = [1] : zipWith (++) xss (map (tail . reverse) xss)               where xss = tail a102473_tabl-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 14 2014
crossrefs: A001040, A001053, A058307, A058308, A058309 are columns of this triangle.
author: _Russell Walsmith_, Dec 07 2000
